name: Akamai WAF
description: The WAF API allows you to manage a common set of lists for use in various Akamai security products such as Kona Site Defender, Web App Protector, and Bot Manager

base_url.description: Base URL for the API. This URL is given to you when you setup the API Client in the Akamai Control Center. e.g. https://akaa-WWWWWWWWWWWW.luna.akamaiapis.net

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using the supplied configuration

actions.verbose: List all network lists available for an authenticated user who belongs to a group, optionally filtered by listType or based on a search string. For extended parameter, when enabled, provides additional response data identifying who and when the lists were created and updated, and the network list's deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. For includeelements parameter, if enabled, the response list includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and yield large response objects. Results appear within the networkLists array, which might be empty if no network lists are available to the client.

search.description: Only list items that match the specified substring in any network list's name or list of items

extended.description: When enabled, provides additional response data (Default: false)

includeelements.description: If enabled, the response list includes all items (Default: false)

actions.description: Gets a network list's most recent syncPoint version
actions.verbose: For extended parameter, when enabled, provides additional response data identifying who and when the lists were created and updated, and the network list's deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. For includeelements parameter, if enabled, the response list includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and yield large response objects.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for each network list. Comma-separated list is allowed

extended.description: When enabled, provides additional response data (Default: false)

includeelements.description: If enabled, the response list includes all items (Default: false)

name.description: Name for the new network list

type.description: Type of the new network list

description.description: Description of the new network list

list.description: IP(s) for the new network list. Comma-separated list is allowed

actions.verbose: You can only remove network lists that never activated. To deactivate a list, you can empty its list of elements.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list

actions.description: Update the network list items and properties
actions.verbose: Allows you to set the name, description, and set of network list items to the resource. The current state of the list will be replaced with the properties and items you provide. The type cannot be changed.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for each network list

name.description: Update or change the name of the network list

description.description: Update or change the description of the network list

actions.description: Adds the specified element(s) to a list
actions.verbose: If the network list's type is IP, the value needs to be a URL-encoded IP address or CIDR block.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list

elements.description: Element(s) to add to the network list. Comma-separated list is allowed

actions.description: Remove the specified element(s) from the list
actions.verbose: If the network list's type is IP, the value needs to be a URL-encoded IP address or CIDR block.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list

elements.description: Element(s) to be removed from the network list. Comma-separated list is allowed

actions.description: Activate the most recent syncPoint version of a network list in either the STAGING or PRODUCTION environment

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list

environment.description: Environment to activate the network (Default: STAGING)

comments.description: Comments to add to the network

notification.description: Notification Recipients for the network list. Comma-separated list is allowed

actions.description: Shows a network list activation status on either the STAGING or PRODUCTION environment

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list

environment.description: The environment in which the list activation occurs (Default: STAGING)

actions.description: Gets a version of a network list
actions.verbose: Gets a version of a network list in its state when activated, with each version identified by its syncPoint value. You can only get syncPoint versions that have been activated. For extended parameter, when enabled, provides additional response data identifying who and when the lists were created and updated, and the network list's deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments.

networklistid.description: Unique identifier for the network list

syncpoint.description: The network list version for which to retrieve the snapshot

extended.description: When enabled, provides additional response data (Default: false)

actions.description: Provides detailed status for a given activation
actions.verbose: Provides detailed status for a given activation, including progress on fast activation and other audit information, in addition to information ordinarily available from the "activation status" action.

activationid.description: Unique identifier for the network list
